traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 6 篇资料参考找到 12 篇资料参考There is no widely known "Civic Morality Archive" in a specific, common context. However, if you are referring to related concepts, there are the following interpretations:### Professional Ethics and Civic Morals by Emile DurkheimThe "Civic Morality Archive" might be a misnomer or a loose reference to "Professional Ethics and Civic Morals". It is a book by Emile Durkheim. First published in English in 1957, it delves into social ethics, professional ethics, and the moral and ethical aspects of civics. It is available in the Internet Archive, which is a digital library offering free access to a vast collection of books, movies, music, and more. You can find the book at [this link](https://archive.org/details/professionalethi0000durk_j3c3).### Concept of Civic Morality- **General Definition**: Civic morality refers to the set of moral norms and principles that individuals should abide by in social life. It encompasses respecting others, obeying laws, and caring about the public interest. It is the moral requirement in the social public life area, reflecting the pursuit of social public life order and justice.- **Significance**: It plays a vital role in maintaining social harmony and order. It is the foundation of a harmonious society, facilitating the normal progress of social interactions and the functioning of society.### Civic Morality in Other ContextsIn some discussions, civic morality is also related to the belief that one should engage in efforts to promote social and public goods, along with actions intended to promote the well-being of others beyond the self. It is neither solely personal individual beliefs that are not publicly shared nor government-prescribed public acts. It has a close relationship with phenomena such as philanthropy, youth development, social inequality, and religious beliefs.
